ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned to think about my own American Jewish identity in a new and critical way.
I learned so much about Jewish American history that I really hadnt gotten to dive into before. It was cool to hear about how the Jewish American identity was formed

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think the once a week structure worked quite well, but I think if there was slightly less and more targeted readings it might help

Professor Stern is really knowledgeable and a cool/chill person. The class was a bit disorganized. There wasnt really a structure and it was sometimes unclear what we were supposed to read. But I didnt really mind.

The main strength of this class is the personal connection to the material for the majority of students who enroll. We often spoke of our lived experiences which made the difficult conversations we had all the more insightful and meaningful. I would say a major weakness of the course was Professor Stern's lack of engagement with us throughout the semester. He often seemed flustered, and I think the course could have benefitted from additional structure.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Definitely! All students (not just Jewish) should take this course because American Jewish history has a lot of fascinating intersections with the histories of other minority groups in the U.S. and the information I learned in this class is not widely known.

Sure, anyone interesting in exploring the complex nature of Jewish identity in America should take this class. Take it from someone who waited way to long to take a religious studies class, it was a great experience.
